question: Which of the following are feedback loops in Scrum?

Scrum teams, events, rules, roles, artifacts

question: Scrum does not allow additional meetings that are not defined in Scrum
Scrum is founded on:

A project management approach with fixed phases
A framework within which people can address complex adaptive problems, while delivering valuable products

options: True - teams should adapt Scrum to their needs

question: Upon what type of process control is Scrum based?

options: A project management approach with defined phases
A software development process with fixed requirements

question: What are three ways Scrum promotes self-organization

question: Scrum is a methodology that tells in detail how to build software

The Daily Scrum lasts 15 minutes or less

question: Does Scrum have a role called "Project Manager"?

question: Scrum does not describe agile processes and techniques.
options: False - Scrum includes detailed technical practices

question: Which of the following is required by Scrum?

question: Which Scrum values are exhibited by not building Product Backlog items that are unlikely to be done?

question: According to Scrum theory, what should an organization do when more than 100 people are required to work on a product?

question: Scrum does not have a role called "project manager."
The three pillars of empirical process control are:
What is the role of Management in Scrum?
options: Directly assign tasks to Development Team members
Make all key product decisions instead of Product Owner
Control the Sprint Backlog and Sprint progress

Support the Product Owner with insights and information into high value product and system capabilities. Support the Scrum Master to cause organizational change that fosters empiricism, self-organization, bottom-up intelligence, and intelligent release of software.

question: You have just been hired by a company new to Scrum. Your management has assigned you to be the Scrum Master of six new Scrum Teams. These teams will build one product. Select two conditions you should strive for in this scenario. Choose 2 answers
options: Scrum has only one artifact: the Product Backlog

There should be only one Product Owner

A Scrum Master is introducing Scrum to a new Development Team. The Development Team has decided that a retrospective is unnecessary. What action should the Scrum Master
take?

Report the team to management for non-compliance.
Force the team to attend without their buy-in.

Tell the team to ignore the request.

Delegate the report to the Product Owner.

question: As a Scrum Master, how would you divide a group of 100 people into multiple Development Teams?

Assign teams according to HR recommendations.

question: A new developer is having continuing conflicts with existing Development Team members and creating a hostile environment. If necessary, who is responsible for removing the team member?

question: A Scrum Master is introducing Scrum to a new Development Team. The Development Team has decided that a retrospective is unnecessary. What action should the Scrum Master take?

Force the team to attend without their buy-in.

question: You are the Scrum Master on a newly formed Scrum Team. Which three of the following activities would probably help the team in starting up? Choose 3 answers
